section.title: Migrating the Websocket Proxy to a Separate Machine
section.para: For security or performance reasons the websocket proxy can run on a separate machine that does not run Red Hat Virtualization Manager. The procedure to migrate the websocket proxy from the Manager machine to a separate machine involves removing the websocket proxy configuration from the Manager machine, then installing the proxy on the separate machine.
The engine-cleanup command can be used to remove the websocket proxy from the Manager machine.

procedure.title: Migrating the Websocket Proxy to a Separate Machine

step.para: On the Manager machine, run engine-cleanup to remove the required configuration.
Type No when asked to remove all components and press Enter.
step.screen: Do you want to remove all components? (Yes, No) [Yes]: No

step.para: Type No when asked to remove the engine and press Enter.
step.screen: Do you want to remove the engine? (Yes, No) [Yes]: No

step.para: Type Yes when asked to remove the websocket proxy and press Enter.
step.screen: Do you want to remove the WebSocket proxy? (Yes, No) [No]: Yes
step.para: Select No if asked to remove any other components.
Install and configure the proxy on the separate machine. See Installing a Websocket Proxy on a Separate Machine in the Installation Guide for instructions.
